name.value: German Corona Consensus Data Set - Implementation Guide

description.value: The German Corona Consensus Data Set (GECCO) is a nationally uniform data set for the systematic collection of scientific data on COVID-19 in Germany.
Apheresis procedures
Blood gas panel is a grouper observation with references to the individual measurements as separate observations.
The blood pressure of a patient.
Body Height of a patient
Body Temperature of a patient
Body Weight of a patient

Chronic kidney diseases as a risk factor for a severe course of an infection with SARS-CoV-2
Chronic liver diseases as a risk factor for a severe course of an infection with SARS-CoV-2
Chronic lung diseases as a risk factor for a severe course of an infection with SARS-CoV-2
Chronic neurological or mental diseases as a risk factor for a severe course of an infection with SARS-CoV-2
Clinical Frailty Scale score

Profile to capture the diagnosis of disease caused by 2019 novel coronavirus. Includes the stage at diagnosis.

Dialysis procedures
The type of discharge from a hospital or care facility
A do-not-resuscitate (DNR) order

Gastrointestinal ulcers as a risk factor for a severe course of an infection with SARS-CoV-2
Base condition for the GECCO dataset that contains an additional extension and constraints on the verificationStatus-element.
Bundle of type 'transaction' used to collect the set of resources as part of the GECCO dataset into a single instance.

Bundle of type 'batch' used to collect the set of resources as part of the GECCO dataset into a single instance for the NUM-CODEX use case and requires that a Consent resource must always be included.
Heart rate of a patient
History of being a tissue or organ recipient
A patient's history of travel

A patient's history of vaccination
This observation captures if the patient participated in one or more interventional clinical trials.
Contact with persons suffering from COVID-19

Oxygen saturation of a patient
pH-value of Blood
Carbon dioxide partial pressure in blood
Oxygen partial pressure in blood
Covers demographic data about the patient
This observation captures if the patient is currently treated in the intensive care unit.

This profile constrains the Observation resource to represent the pregnancy status.
Placing the patient in prone position
Records the details of radiological imaging procedures performed on the patient.

Observation to capture the SOFA score. Based on: Vincent JL, Moreno R, Takala J, et al. The SOFA (Sepsis-related Organ Failure Assessment) score to describe organ dysfunction/failure. On behalf of the Working Group on Sepsis-Related Problems of the European Society of Intensive Care Medicine. Intensive Care Med. 1996;22(7):707-710. doi:10.1007/BF01709751
